betterquesting:10.desc:8:
If you want to seperate wires from each other you can make them into insulated wires of different colors and they will not attach to wires of other colors (you can't attach to green to blue as an example) though they can all be attached to uninsulated wires and otherwise function exactly like uninsulated wires.

Bundled cables allow you to essentially cross colored wires without them losing their color identity. So if you have an on white wire and an off blue wire feeding into bundled cables then those states shall be the same when they feed out of the bundled cable.

You can also color bundled cables if you don't want them to connect to bundled cables of other cables.

Do note that you can't feed bare wires from bundled cables but can feed colored wires in and out of them.
